New Records: LeBron James became the first player in league history to play a game in his teens and in his 40s
Key Match Events: Jarrett Allen scored 27 points and grabbed 14 rebounds, Donovan Mitchell added 26 points and Evan Mobley chipped in 20 for the Cavaliers
Austin Reaves led the Lakers with an impressive near-triple-double of 35 points, nine rebounds and 10 assists
Anthony Davis scored 28 points and grabbed 13 rebounds
Post-Match Reflections: LeBron James expressed his thoughts on his first game at 40 years old
The Cavaliers coach emphasized the importance of the win in their league-best record
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Cavaliers notched their eighth straight win to push their league-best record to 29-4
The Celtics won by the second-largest margin of victory in franchise history
The Bucks erased a 19-point deficit on the way to a 120-112 victory over the Indiana Pacers
Others: Giannis Antetokounmpo found his rhythm after scoring just four points in the first half, finishing with 30 points and 12 rebounds
